main event: On 26 January 1955 in Lakeland, Florida, a civilian observed a circular object moving across the sky at high speed, followed by a trail of white smoke or vapor.
interesting points: The object was observed to move at high speeds and leave a trail of white smoke or vapor behind it.
The report mentioned a small explosion followed by a black smoke trail, along with objects falling from the explosion and presumed to make ground contact.
The observer stated that the explosion was not caused by a vapor trail and that the object had all the characteristics of a small meteorite or other celestial object.

The sighting was evaluated as 'Probably Explainable' and was thought to be a small white ball, estimated to be about 6 inches in diameter, following a zig-zag course for approximately 30 seconds after a small explosion.
The report contains details of the locations of observers, weather and wind conditions at the time and place of the sighting, and information about operations offices receiving the reports.
sighted object: Circular object moving at high speed with a trail of white smoke or vapor
